snippet: In 16 markets, private equity firms, hedge funds and pension systems are buying up relatively inexpensive houses to rent them out.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column contends institutional investors are driving up home prices in markets that have been hit hard by foreclosures during and after the Great Recession by buying up relatively inexpensive homes.
lead_paragraph: In 16 markets, private equity firms, hedge funds and pension systems are buying up relatively inexpensive houses to rent them out.

headline.print_headline: Investors Are Pushing Starter-Home Prices Up
headline.main: Investors Are Pushing Starter-Home Prices Up
